intro: Nephrodesmus macrobotryosus, commonly known as the giant liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rock crevices. The plant features a thalloid structure with a central axis and leaf-like structures called phyllidia, which are arranged in a rosette pattern. Its reproductive structures, known as archegonia and antheridia, are located on the underside of the thallus, facilitating sexual reproduction. Nephrodesmus macrobotryosus plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
